title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Weatherman (2024). cbbplotR: CBB Logo Plots 'ggplot2'. R package version 0.0.1, https://cbbplotr.aweatherman.com, https://andreweatherman.github.io/cbbplotR/, https://github.com/andreweatherman/cbbplotR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cbbplotR: CBB Logo Plots in 'ggplot2'},   author = {Andrew Weatherman},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://cbbplotr.aweatherman.com, https://andreweatherman.github.io/cbbplotR/},   url = {https://github.com/andreweatherman/cbbplotR}, }

title: cbbplotR Package
text: Welcome cbbplotR, R package designed bring vibrant world college basketball data visualizations. package, extension nflplotR, go-toolkit incorporating college basketball team conference logos, player headshots, team colors ggplot2 plots. Tailored work seamlessly cbbdata, cbbplotR requires team conference names match found cbbdata package. limited internal name conversion function teams conferences match common sites, recommend use cbbdata names. want request adding specific name conversions, please open issue package’s GitHub. cbbplotR extension popular {sport}plotR family packages, including nflplotR, nbaplotR, mlbplotR, cfbplotR. package heavily adapted nflplotR ggpath developer Sebastian Carl.

title: cbbplotR Package
text: get started cbbplotR, can install using pak package.
code: if (!require("pak")) install.packages("pak") pak::pak("andreweatherman/cbbplotR")

title: cbbplotR Package
text: Visualize data style using cbbplotR’s team logo plots. plots visually appealing social media also intuitive simple create. geom_cbb_teams function integrates team logos ggplot2 scatter plots, requiring team aesthetic aligned cbbdata.  plot also makes use geom_mean_lines function draw reference lines refer average values variable. (geom_median_lines also available!) functions pulled directly ggpath package.
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') %>%   ggplot(aes(adj_d, adj_o, team = team)) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_d, y0 = adj_o), color = 'black') +   geom_cbb_teams(width = 0.08) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies in the ACC',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')

title: cbbplotR Package
text: addition plotting team logos, cbbplotR also allows plotting conference logos. functionality analogous geom_cbb_teams requires valid conference name passed conference aesthetic.
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_conf_factors(year = 2024) %>%   slice(1:10) %>%    ggplot(aes(adj_d, adj_o, conference = conf)) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_d, y0 = adj_o), color = 'black') +   geom_cbb_conferences(width = 0.08) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies in 2024 for Top 10 Conferences',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')

title: cbbplotR Package
text: cbbplotR, can also incorporate player headshots visualizations. Note: ’ll need provide ESPN player IDs, cbbplotR cbbdata doesn’t automatically retrieve. can grab ESPN player IDs manually, can use snippet grab player IDs given team: plot player headshots, simply include column ESPN player IDs data pass column player_id aesthetic geom_cbb_headshot.
code: # replace `150` with a teams' ESPN ID jsonlite::fromJSON(glue::glue('http://site.api.espn.com/apis/site/v2/sports/basketball/mens-college-basketball/teams/{ESPN_TEAM_ID}/roster')) %>%    pluck('athletes') %>%    as_tibble() %>%    select(id, displayName) set.seed(10)  ids <- jsonlite::fromJSON('http://site.api.espn.com/apis/site/v2/sports/basketball/mens-college-basketball/teams/150/roster') %>%    purrr::pluck('athletes') %>%    dplyr::as_tibble() %>%    dplyr::select(id, displayName)  random_data <- tibble(   val1 = rnorm(nrow(ids)),   val2 = rnorm(nrow(ids)),   id = ids$id )  random_data %>%    ggplot(aes(val1, val2)) +   geom_cbb_headshots(aes(player_id = id, width = 0.1)) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Random data to show plotting headshots')

title: cbbplotR Package
text: lot Division 1 basketball teams, drawing effective plots hundreds logos challenging. One standout features cbbplotR ability highlight specific elements plots. particularly useful dealing large number logos data points, want draw attention key items. can apply highlighting teams, conferences, players. Highlighting cbbplotR designed intuitive flexible. several methods disposal: Transparency Adjustment: setting low alpha level elements except ones wish highlight, can subtly bring forward focus points keeping context background. Grayscale Application: Another method involves converting non-essential logos grayscale, making colored logos highlighted teams conferences stand vividly.

title: cbbplotR Package
text: Implementing methods straightforward. can adjust data manually, providing alpha /color values certain teams, pass values aes layer – let cbbplotR heavy lifting. Without needing touch data, can pass vector teams, conferences, player IDs highlight_X argument geom_cbb_X functions specify highlight type – alpha, color, . example, let’s assume want highlight four Tobacco Road teams still show position relative rest ACC.  example, chose highlight teams increasing transparency changing logos grayscale non-selected teams. can choose , highlight_method = "", just one, highlight_method = "alpha" // highlight_method = "color". process analogous geom methods – argument names switch relative function (highlight_conferences highlight_players).
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') %>%   ggplot(aes(adj_d, adj_o, team = team)) +   geom_cbb_teams(highlight_teams = c('Duke', 'North Carolina', 'Wake Forest', 'North Carolina St.'),                  width = 0.08, highlight_method = 'both') +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies in 2024 for Top 10 Conferences',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')

title: cbbplotR Package
text: cbbplotR extends standard capabilities ggplot2 allowing place logos headshots various parts plot, axes labels inline plot titles.

title: cbbplotR Package
text: element_cbb_teams, element_cbb_conferences, element_cbb_headshots, can replace traditional axis text logos headshots. particularly effective plots team identity recognizable impactful just names.  process analogous two element_cbb_X functions. must correctly call element_X function appropriate theme call -> .e. axis.text.x broader axis.text.
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') %>%   ggplot(aes(team, adj_o)) +   geom_col() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     axis.text.x = element_cbb_teams(size = 1)   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies in 2024 for Top 10 Conferences',        y = 'Adjusted offense',        x = NULL)

title: cbbplotR Package
text: can also place logos facet titles element_cbb_X family functions.
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings_archive(year = 2024) %>%    summarize(avg_rating = mean(barthag), .by = c(conf, date)) %>%    filter(conf %in% c('ACC', 'B10', 'B12')) %>%    ggplot(aes(date, avg_rating)) +   geom_line() +   facet_wrap(~conf) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     strip.text.x = element_cbb_conferences(size = 1)   ) +   labs(title = 'Average T-Rank Rating for Select Conferences in 2024',        x = 'Date',        y = 'T-Rank Rating')

what: Utilizing Colors and Fills in cbbplotR
title: cbbplotR Package
text: cbbplotR provides powerful functionalities incorporating team conference colors ggplot2 visualizations. using scale_color/fill_cbb_X functions, can easily map aesthetic properties plots official colors college basketball teams conferences. make functions work, simply assign color /fill properties aes team conference columns, add appropriate scale function.

previous_headings: Utilizing Colors and Fills in cbbplotR
title: cbbplotR Package
text: scale_color_cbb_teams scale_fill_cbb_teams functions allow assign team-specific colors various plot elements. scale_color_cbb_conferences scale_fill_cbb_conferences functions work manner allow assign conference-specific color values.
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') %>%   ggplot(aes(team, adj_o, fill = team)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_cbb_teams() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     axis.text.x = element_cbb_teams(size = 1)   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies in 2024 for Top 10 Conferences',        y = 'Adjusted offense',        x = NULL)

what: Enhancing Titles with Logos in cbbplotR
title: cbbplotR Package
text: cbbplotR ships ggplot_cbb_logo_title gt_cbb_logo_title functions allow seamlessly incorporate team conference logos titles.

previous_headings: Enhancing Titles with Logos in cbbplotR
title: cbbplotR Package
text: ggplot_cbb_logo_title function designed integrate logos directly titles ggplot2 plots. works passing logo plot.tag setting appropriate coordinates position . can adjust position logo hjust vjust arguments. function works plotting team logos, conference logos, player headshots. must specify type one type = c('team', 'conference', 'headshot').
code: cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings_archive(year = 2024, team = 'Duke') %>%    ggplot(aes(date, rank, color = team)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   scale_color_cbb_teams() +   theme_minimal() +   ggplot_cbb_logo_title('Duke', type = 'team', size = 1.8) +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',   ) +   labs(title = '2024 Duke T-Rank',        subtitle = "This is to show how to include a logo in-line with a title plot",        x = 'Date',        y = 'T-Rank')

previous_headings: Enhancing Titles with Logos in cbbplotR
what: Adding Logos in gt Table Titles
title: cbbplotR Package
text: Similarly, gt_cbb_logo_title function tailored use gt tables integrate logos directly table header. function works returning HTML code wrapped HTML tag passed tab_header(title) function. Like ggplot_cbb_logo_title, can specify whether want plot team logo, conference logo, player headshot type argument. can adjust logo size logo_height, can also adjust various things title , including X_font_size, X_font_weight, X_lineheight title subtitle. use gt table theme, change font later table, changes propogate title . want plot custom image, perhaps retro logo, can specify link image logo_link (override value type).
code: title <- gt_cbb_logo_title(   title = 'ACC Adjusted Team Efficiencies',   subtitle = 'A random gt table to show off logo capabilities',   value = 'ACC',   type = 'conference',   logo_height = 30 )  cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') %>%    select(team, adj_o, adj_d) %>%    cbbdata::cbd_gt_logos(team, team) %>%    gt() %>%    fmt_markdown(team) %>%    tab_header(title = html(title))

what: My Plots pane in RStudio is slow!
title: cbbplotR Package
text: plotting numerous team logos, might notice RStudio can slow return plot – can possibly lead R session aborting. fix , cbbplotR borrows function ggpath package called ggpreview – saves temporary image plot returns Viewer pane. recommend expand window browser. use ggpreview, need store plot variable pass ggpreview function. function also takes arguments plot dimensions. example, draw plot showing every team’s adjusted efficiencies, require rendering 362 logos, definitely cause us problems. ggpreview, can store plot variable view temporary image ! entire process takes fewer 10 seconds.
code: p <- cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024) %>%   ggplot(aes(adj_d, adj_o, team = team)) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_d, y0 = adj_o), color = 'black') +   geom_cbb_teams(width = 0.03) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')  ggpreview(p)

title: cbbplotR Package
text: feature recommendations run bugs, please open issue GitHub. can also contact directly Twitter, prefer latter. looking college basketball R packages, check cbbdata – also developed maintained .

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 — element_cbb_teams
text: functions enable images non-data parts ggplot2 layers.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 — element_cbb_teams
code: element_cbb_teams(   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 0.5 )  element_cbb_headshots(   player_id_column,   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 1.5 )  element_cbb_conferences(   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 0.5 )  element_path(...)

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 — element_cbb_teams
text: alpha transparency level 0-1. hjust, vjust horizontal vertical adjustment respectively 0-1. color image colorized color. Use special character "b/w" set black white. size output grob size cm. ... Arguments passed ggpath::element_path colour,color image colorized color. Use special character "b/w" set black white. information valid color names ggplot2 see https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/articles/ggplot2-specs.html?q=colour#colour--fill. hjust,vjust horizontal vertical adjustment respectively. Must numerical value 0 1. angle angle element numerical value 0° 360°.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 — element_cbb_teams
text: S3 object class element.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 — element_cbb_teams
text: element_cbb_logo(): draws CBB team logos instead names. element_cbb_conferences(): draws CBB conference logos instead names. element_cbb_headshot(): draws CBB player headshots instead ESPN player IDs. element_path(): draws images valid image URLs instead URL.

what: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
text: geom used plot college basketball conference logos instead points ggplot. requires x, y aesthetics well valid CBB conference name cbbdata. Use width adjust size logos.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
code: geom_cbb_conferences(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   highlight_conferences = NULL,   highlight_method = "alpha",   highlight_alpha = 0.5 )

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). stat statistical transformation use data layer, either ggproto Geom subclass string naming stat stripped stat_ prefix (e.g. "count" rather "stat_count") position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ... arguments passed ggplot2::layer(). na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
text: ggplot2 layer (ggplot2::layer()) can added plot created ggplot2::ggplot(). @examples

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing College Basketball Conference Logos — geom_cbb_conferences
text: geom_cbb_conferences() understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x - x-coordinate. y - y-coordinate. conference - valid conference name cbbdata. alpha = NULL - transparency level 0-1. color = NULL - image colorized color. Use special character "b/w" set black white. angle = 0 - angle image 0-360. hjust = 0.5 - horizontal adjustment relative given x coordinate 0-1. vjust = 0.5 - vertical adjustment relative given y coordinate 0-1. width = 1.0 - width image. height = 1.0 - height image.

what: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: geoms can used draw horizontal vertical reference lines ggplot. use data aesthetics x0 y0 compute median mean draw line. copied directly ggpath package.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
code: geom_median_lines(...)  geom_mean_lines(...)

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: ... Arguments passed ggpath::geom_mean_lines, ggpath::geom_median_lines mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behavior default plot specification.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: ggplot2 layer (ggplot2::layer()) can added plot created ggplot2::ggplot().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: functions outsourced ggpath package. See ggpath::geom_median_lines ggpath::geom_mean_lines details.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: geom_median_lines() geom_mean_lines() understand following aesthetics (least one bold aesthetics required): x0 - variable compute median/mean drawn vertical line. y0 - variable compute median/mean drawn horizontal line. alpha = NA - alpha channel, .e. transparency level, numerical value 0 1. color = "red" - color drawn lines. linetype = 2 - linetype drawn lines. size = 0.5 - size drawn lines. Deprecated ggplot2 v3.4.0, use linewidth instead. linewidth = 0.5 - width drawn lines. Starting ggplot2 v3.4.0.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
code: library(ggplot2)  # inherit top level aesthetics ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, y0 = mpg, x0 = disp)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # draw horizontal line only ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, y0 = mpg)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # draw vertical line only ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, x0 = disp)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # choose your own value ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines(x0 = 400, y0 = 15) +   geom_mean_lines(x0 = 150, y0 = 30, color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()

what: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: function previews ggplot actual dimensions order see look saved. also significantly faster default preview RStudio ggplots created using cbbplotR. copied directly nflplotR.

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
code: ggpreview(   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   width = NA,   height = NA,   asp = NULL,   dpi = 300,   device = "png",   units = c("in", "cm", "mm", "px"),   scale = 1,   limitsize = TRUE,   bg = NULL,   ... )

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: plot Plot save, defaults last plot displayed. width, height, units Plot size units ("", "cm", "mm", "px"). supplied, uses size current graphics device. asp aspect ratio plot calculated width / height. numeric value (NULL) height plot recalculated height = width / asp. dpi Plot resolution. Also accepts string input: "retina" (320), "print" (300), "screen" (72). Applies raster output types. device Device use. Can either device function (e.g. png), one "eps", "ps", "tex" (pictex), "pdf", "jpeg", "tiff", "png", "bmp", "svg" "wmf" (windows ). scale Multiplicative scaling factor. limitsize TRUE (default), ggsave() save images larger 50x50 inches, prevent common error specifying dimensions pixels. bg Background colour. NULL, uses plot.background fill value plot theme. ... arguments passed graphics device function, specified device.

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: return value, called side effects.

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
code: library(cbbplotR) library(ggplot2)  df <- data.frame(   random_value = runif(3, 0, 1),   team = c('Duke', 'Arizona', 'North Carolina') )  # use logos for x-axis # note that the plot is assigned to the object "p" p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = team, y = random_value)) +   geom_col(aes(color = team, fill = team), width = 0.5) +   scale_color_cbb(type = "primary") +   scale_fill_cbb(alpha = 0.4) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_cbb_logo(size = 1)) #> Error in scale_color_cbb(type = "primary"): could not find function "scale_color_cbb"  # preview p with defined width and aspect ratio (only available in RStudio) if (rstudioapi::isAvailable()){   ggpreview(p, width = 5, asp = 16/9) }

what: Add a Team Logo and Title/Subtitle to a gt Table. — gt_cbb_logo_title
title: Add a Team Logo and Title/Subtitle to a gt Table. — gt_cbb_logo_title
text: requires wrapping function around html passing tab_header gt. See function example.

title: Add a Team Logo and Title/Subtitle to a gt Table. — gt_cbb_logo_title
code: gt_cbb_logo_title(   title,   subtitle,   value = NULL,   logo_link = NULL,   type = c("team", "conference", "headshot"),   title_font_size = 24,   title_font_weight = "bold",   title_lineheight = 0.5,   subtitle_font_size = 16,   subtitle_font_weight = "normal",   subtitle_lineheight = 0.5,   logo_height = 65 )

title: Add a Team Logo and Title/Subtitle to a gt Table. — gt_cbb_logo_title
text: title gt table title subtitle gt table subtitle logo_link want plot different image, pass valid URL link . title_font_size size title font (px). title_font_weight weight title (normal bold). title_lineheight line-height title. subtitle_font_size size subtitle font (px). subtitle_font_weight weight subtitle (normal bold). subtitle_lineheight line-height subtitle. logo_height height logo (px). team valid team name cbbdata.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Color and fill for college basketball teams — scale_color_cbb_teams
title: Color and fill for college basketball teams — scale_color_cbb_teams
text: functions map college basketball team names team colors color fill aesthetics

title: Color and fill for college basketball teams — scale_color_cbb_teams
code: scale_color_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_colour_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_fill_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "fill",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_color_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_colour_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_fill_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "fill",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )

title: Color and fill for college basketball teams — scale_color_cbb_teams
text: ... Arguments passed discrete_scale palette palette function called single integer argument (number levels scale) returns values take (e.g., scales::hue_pal()). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks (scale limits) character vector breaks function takes limits input returns breaks output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale values character vector defines possible values scale order function accepts existing (automatic) values returns new ones. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. drop unused factor levels omitted scale? default, TRUE, uses levels appear data; FALSE uses levels factor. na.translate Unlike continuous scales, discrete scales can easily show missing values, default. want remove missing values discrete scale, specify na.translate = FALSE. na.value na.translate = TRUE, aesthetic value missing values displayed ? apply position scales NA always placed far right. aesthetics names aesthetics scale works . scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. super super class use constructed scale guide function used create guide name. See guides() information. size logo size pixels. applied height x-scale width y-scale.

title: cbbplotR 0.1.0
text: Beta release; formally “announced” package via Twitter.
